newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing share market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing share market report.

text.p: Dutch shares closed a little lower on Thursday after a volatile session, influenced by Friday's option expiry and continued interest rate uncertainty.
"There are quite a lot of calls being offered," said one dealer.
He added that options had already had a strong impact on the underlying share market in recent days.
"Shares are likely to remain volatile," he said.
The AEX share index ended off 0.17 points at 935.59 after touching a day's high at 945.14 and a low of 928.30 points.
Chemical firm Akzo Nobel fell further today.
Akzo Nobel fell 7.50 guilders today to 323.00 after shedding 15.50 guilders yesterday.
Food group Nutricia was another stock to continue dropping strongly, and fell 9.40 guilders to 346.60 after slipping 6.50 on Wednesday.
ASM Lithography strongly outperformed the market after the stock jumped in the United States overnight. It rose 13.40 guilders to 183.90, but touched 188.00 guilders earlier.
Brewer Heineken rose 5.00 guilders on a recent buy recommendation and dealers said there had been a big buyer in the market today. --Amsterdam Newsroom +31 20 504 5000
